intro: Chloropetalum surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Suriname and Guyana. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
